frameDefinitions: A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so.
A Place is located far off from centers of population, culture, and/or trade.
An Item comes to be attached to a Goal, with a Connector forming a bond between the Handle of the Item and the Goal (or some part of it).

In this frame a Hindrance makes it more difficult for a Protagonist to complete their intended Action or a Hindrance directly affects an Action where the Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor.
An Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid Capture  or contact with a Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power.
frameExamples: Rain <t>prevented</t> the ball game from taking place.
According to plan, the front part of the hull quietly <t>attached</t> to the docking gear.
Malcolm was <t>hindered</t> by his drinking problem .
listRoleDefinitions: A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> or an <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>.
A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, a <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or a <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics control a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
The <fex name='deg'>Degree</fex> to which the Controlling element affects the Dependent element.
The <fex name='tim'>Time</fex> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not.
The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The town or area that is in a remote location.
<fen>Connector</fen> identifies the  instrument used to attach, usually in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the first <fen>Item</fen> is attached.
The time when the attaching event takes place.
The location where the attaching event takes place.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the entity that tends towards or plans some <fen>Action</fen> which the <fen>Hindrance</fen> causes to be more difficult.
The <fen>Hindrance</fen> is the force which makes the <fen>Action</fen> more difficult or less likely to be successfully completed. The <fen>Hindrance</fen> may be a lack of enabling force:

The <fen>Action</fen> is what the <fen>Protagonist</fen> desires to do, which is made more difficult by the <fen>Hindrance</fen>. It can also be a natural act or collective endeavor, not linked to an overt <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Hindrance</fen> affects the <fen>Protagonist</fen> or <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where  he <fen>Hindrance</fen> affects the <fen>Protagonist</fen> or <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Evader</fen> moves under its own power to <fen>Capture</fen> or contact with the <fen>Pursuer</fen>. Normally the <fen>Evader</fen> frame element is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Pursuer</fen> is going after the <fen>Evader</fen> unless they act.
An actual or hypothetical  event in which the <fen>Pursuer</fen> takes physical control of the <fen>Evader</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the Evading occurs.
listRoleExamples: Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.
He lives in the <fex><t>backwoods</t></fex> of Canada.
The remoras attach to the whale <fex>with their strong jaws</fex>.
The remoras attach <fex>to the underside of the whale</fex>.
The project was hampered <fex>by a lack of funds</fex>.
<fex>The mouse</fex> eluded the cats for only a few minutes.
The mouse eluded <fex>the cats</fex> for only a few minutes.
Rýmirez-Sýnchez , tried in absentia , had evaded <fex>capture</fex> since the murders in Paris on June 27 , 1975
Smithers got away <fex>at the stroke of midnight</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Front of Pack Labelling Scheme
